steps.title: Draw a small circle.
steps.content: Draw a small circle. This will be the outline for the dog’s head. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Draw a quadrilateral extending off of the circle.
steps.content: Draw a quadrilateral extending off of the circle. This will be the beginning of the dog’s snout. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Add 2 triangles on the top of the circle.
steps.content: Add 2 triangles on the top of the circle. These will be the dog’s ears. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Draw 2 straight lines coming off of the bottom of the circle.
steps.content: Draw 2 straight lines coming off of the bottom of the circle. This will be the outline of the dog’s neck. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Draw a large, vertical oval under the neck.
steps.content: Draw a large, vertical oval under the neck. The oval will make up the upper portion of the dog’s body. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Draw a smaller vertical oval overlapping with the bottom of the bigger one.
steps.content: Draw a smaller vertical oval overlapping with the bottom of the bigger one. This will be the dog’s lower body, including its stomach. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Add an even smaller oval overlapping with the previous oval you drew.
steps.content: Add an even smaller oval overlapping with the previous oval you drew. This oval will be the dog’s lower back. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Join the biggest oval and the smallest oval with a straight line.
steps.content: Join the biggest oval and the smallest oval with a straight line. This line will form the dog’s back. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Draw straight lines extending down off the big oval.
steps.content: Draw straight lines extending down off the big oval. These lines will make up the front legs. Connect the lines at the bottom to close off the legs. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Draw rectangles extending off the front legs and smaller ovals.
steps.content: Draw rectangles extending off the front legs and smaller ovals. These will be the dog’s paws. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Draw an upward curving line coming off the smallest oval.
steps.content: Draw an upward curving line coming off the smallest oval. This line will be the beginning of the dog’s tail. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Add a small, horizontal oval at the top of the front leg.
steps.content: Add a small, horizontal oval at the top of the front leg. This will be the dog’s leg bone and muscle area.

steps.title: Draw a rough outline of the dog using the shapes you’ve drawn so far.
steps.content: Draw a rough outline of the dog using the shapes you’ve drawn so far. Start filling in the details, like the dog’s eyes, nose, mouth, nails, and ears. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Erase all of the guidelines you drew.
steps.content: Erase all of the guidelines you drew. When you’re finished erasing the guidelines, you should be left with the just the detailed outline of the dog you drew.

steps.title: Color in the dog to finish your drawing.
steps.content: Color in the dog to finish your drawing. You can color in your dog however you’d like, but if you’re going for a realistic-looking dog, stick with shades of brown. If you don't want to color your dog, try adding shadows with cross-hatching. Make short lines going in one direction and then adding lines going in the other direction to darken the shade. [13] X Research source [​​v161058_b01]. 26 July 2019.

steps.title: Draw 2 horizontal ovals side by side.
steps.content: Draw 2 horizontal ovals side by side. Make one oval slightly larger than the other. Make sure they're not too far apart. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Draw a light outline of the dog around the 2 ovals.
steps.content: Draw a light outline of the dog around the 2 ovals. First, draw a line that goes down and over the ovals you drew. Then, draw a line underneath it that does the same thing. For the bottom line, have it bend in a little bit in between the ovals. Next, draw the beginnings of legs. Finally, outline the head by drawing a circle with an oval that’s partially overlapping it. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Add additional details to the outline.
steps.content: Add additional details to the outline. Draw the ears, snout, paws, and tail. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Erase the guidelines in your drawing and add more detail.
steps.content: Erase the guidelines in your drawing and add more detail. Once you’ve erased the guidelines, you can draw the outlines of the fur. You can also smudge your pencil lead lightly to create shadows on the dog. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Color in your drawing.
steps.content: Color in your drawing. For a Doberman pinscher, you’ll want to use black with shades of brown to color it in. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Draw a circle.
steps.content: Draw a circle. This will be the outline of the head for your cartoon puppy.

steps.title: Draw a horizontal oval under the circle so they overlap.
steps.content: Draw a horizontal oval under the circle so they overlap. This will be the outline of the puppy’s snout.

steps.title: Draw 4 small ovals inside the circle.
steps.content: Draw 4 small ovals inside the circle. These ovals will be the puppy’s eyes. Start by drawing 2 small ovals inside the circle. Then, draw a smaller oval inside each one.

steps.title: Add a small circle inside the big, horizontal oval.
steps.content: Add a small circle inside the big, horizontal oval. This will become the puppy’s nose.

steps.title: Draw curved lines under the nose for the mouth.
steps.content: Draw curved lines under the nose for the mouth. First, draw 2 upward curving lines that meet to form a “w” shape. Then, draw a third upward curving line underneath them.

steps.title: Use curved lines to draw one of the puppy’s ears.
steps.content: Use curved lines to draw one of the puppy’s ears. Draw the ear so it’s coming out of the top of the puppy’s head, off to one side.

steps.title: Draw the second ear on the other side of the head.
steps.content: Draw the second ear on the other side of the head. Use curved lines as you did for the first ear.

steps.title: Add a horizontal rectangle below the large oval.
steps.content: Add a horizontal rectangle below the large oval. Have the rectangle and oval overlap slightly.

steps.title: Draw a square with curved sides underneath the rectangle.
steps.content: Draw a square with curved sides underneath the rectangle. The square and rectangle should overlap slightly. This will make up part of the outline of the puppy’s body.

steps.title: Add a second, slightly-bigger curved square underneath the first one.
steps.content: Add a second, slightly-bigger curved square underneath the first one. This will be the outline of the puppy’s stomach.

steps.title: Draw a third curved shape underneath the previous one you drew.
steps.content: Draw a third curved shape underneath the previous one you drew. It should overlap slightly with the previous one. This will be the puppy’s lower back.

steps.title: Draw a small oval at the bottom of the previous shape you drew.
steps.content: Draw a small oval at the bottom of the previous shape you drew. The small oval will be the hind leg paw.

steps.title: Add curved lines extending down off the upper body for the front leg.
steps.content: Add curved lines extending down off the upper body for the front leg. Connect the ends of the curved lines, but leave the tops disconnected.

steps.title: Draw an oval at the bottom of the front leg.
steps.content: Draw an oval at the bottom of the front leg. This is the outline for the paw on the front leg.

steps.title: Draw 2 more lines extending down off the upper body for the other front leg.
steps.content: Draw 2 more lines extending down off the upper body for the other front leg. Connect these lines at the bottom like you did for the other leg.

steps.title: Add a small oval at the bottom of the second front leg.
steps.content: Add a small oval at the bottom of the second front leg. This will be the puppy’s other front paw.

steps.title: Draw a short, upward curving line coming off the lower back.
steps.content: Draw a short, upward curving line coming off the lower back. This is the beginning of the puppy’s tail.

steps.title: Make a detailed outline of the puppy using the guidelines you’ve drawn so far.
steps.content: Make a detailed outline of the puppy using the guidelines you’ve drawn so far. You should include details like the eyes, tongue, and nails.

steps.title: Erase all of the guidelines.
steps.content: Erase all of the guidelines. When you’re finished, you should be left with a detailed outline of the puppy.

steps.title: Color in your drawing.
steps.content: Color in your drawing. You can color in the puppy using any colors you’d like! Some good options are brown, black, gray, and tan.

steps.title: Draw 2 circles and a horizontal oval.
steps.content: Draw 2 circles and a horizontal oval. Make one of the circles bigger than the other, and have the smaller circle be above the oval and bigger circle. These shapes will make up the framework for the rest of your drawing.

steps.title: Draw the dog’s legs coming off of the oval and bigger circle.
steps.content: Draw the dog’s legs coming off of the oval and bigger circle. Divide the legs into different trapezoids, rectangles, and polygons. Have 2 legs coming off of the oval and 2 legs coming off of the bigger circle.

steps.title: Draw the outline of the dog’s body.
steps.content: Draw the outline of the dog’s body. Use curved lines to connect the oval to the circles. Also, add a small tail coming off the side of the bigger circle.

steps.title: Add the details of the dog’s head to the small circle.
steps.content: Add the details of the dog’s head to the small circle. Refine the drawing to make distinct eyes, ears, a snout, a nose, and a mouth.

steps.title: Trace your drawing with a pen and erase the guidelines.
steps.content: Trace your drawing with a pen and erase the guidelines. Now you should be left with a detailed outline of the dog.

steps.title: Color your drawing in.
steps.content: Color your drawing in. You can use any colors you’d like. To make your dog look realistic, use colors like gray, black, and brown.

steps.title: Look up a reference.
steps.content: Look up a reference. References are important because they help your drawings be more realistic. Try to find a picture that isn't too fuzzy or blurred. If they are too fuzzy or blurred, you can't see the fine details on the dog and therefore it won't look near as good.

steps.title: Blow it up.
steps.content: Blow it up. You can blow them up by copying and pasting them on a slide show, Google Docs, or Publisher. By blowing the picture up, you can see details that are small easier.

steps.title: Draw the eyes.
steps.content: Draw the eyes. To me, the eyes are the most important part of a drawing because if the eyes look wrong, so will the rest. Make sure your eyes aren't too small and if one eye is farther away than the other, remember to make it smaller.

steps.title: Add a line to show where the nose should start.
steps.content: Add a line to show where the nose should start. Add a line between the eyes and compare it to the reference. Then make the line into a cross, facing the way your reference's head is facing. At the end of the line, draw the nose. On dog's noses, there is always a spot where the light is directly hitting the nose. This spot is typically at the top of the nose. Make sure your nose isn't completely the same color by adding highlights and shadows. Remember to draw nostrils and make them a darker color than the rest.

steps.title: Draw the ears.
steps.content: Draw the ears. To frame out the head, draw the ears of the dog first. Make sure they are still proportional to the eyes and nose.

steps.title: Draw the mouth.
steps.content: Draw the mouth. My only tip for this is that you shouldn't make your mouth too thick. It's better too thin than thick.

steps.title: Frame it out.
steps.content: Frame it out. After you have drawn the ears, you frame the face by connecting the ears at the top first. Then about near the middle of the ears (if they are floppy ears) draw a line that goes a little beneath the mouth and connects it to the middle of the other ear.

steps.title: Check and make sure that your drawing of the head is still proportional.
steps.content: Check and make sure that your drawing of the head is still proportional.

steps.title: Draw the fundamentals of the dog's fur.
steps.content: Draw the fundamentals of the dog's fur. The fundamentals of fur drawing are that not each hair on a dog's body goes the same direction. They're not the same length either, so make sure that you vary the length and direction even if it's only by a fraction of an inch.

steps.title: Do the fur in sections.
steps.content: Do the fur in sections. Make sure your sections are small. Also, remember to check your reference. For example, if you are doing a section near the ear, check the reference in that area and keep your strokes smaller than the image on the screen unless that's how big your drawing is.
